comment:
* LocaleList is an immutable list of Locales, typically used to keep an ordered list of user
 * preferences for locales.

methods.name: public Locale get(int index)
methods.comment:
* Retrieves the {@link Locale} at the specified index.
     *
     * @param index The position to retrieve.
     * @return The {@link Locale} in the given index.

methods.name: public boolean isEmpty()
methods.comment:
* Returns whether the {@link LocaleList} contains no {@link Locale} items.
     *
     * @return {@code true} if this {@link LocaleList} has no {@link Locale} items, {@code false}
     *     otherwise.

methods.name: public int size()
methods.comment: * Returns the number of {@link Locale} items in this {@link LocaleList}.

methods.name: public int indexOf(Locale locale)
methods.comment:
* Searches this {@link LocaleList} for the specified {@link Locale} and returns the index of
     * the first occurrence.
     *
     * @param locale The {@link Locale} to search for.
     * @return The index of the first occurrence of the {@link Locale} or {@code -1} if the item
     *     wasn't found.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int parcelableFlags)
public String toLanguageTags()
methods.comment: * Retrieves a String representation of the language tags in this list.

methods.name: public static LocaleList getEmptyLocaleList()
methods.comment: * Retrieve an empty instance of {@link LocaleList}.

methods.name: public static LocaleList forLanguageTags(@Nullable String list)
methods.comment:
* Generates a new LocaleList with the given language tags.
     *
     * @param list The language tags to be included as a single {@link String} separated by commas.
     * @return A new instance with the {@link Locale} items identified by the given tags.

methods.name: public static boolean isPseudoLocale(Locale locale)
methods.comment:
* Returns true if locale is a pseudo-locale, false otherwise.
     * {@hide}

methods.name: public static boolean isPseudoLocale(@Nullable ULocale locale)
methods.comment: * Returns true if locale is a pseudo-locale, false otherwise.

methods.name: private static int matchScore(Locale supported, Locale desired)
private int computeFirstMatchIndex(Collection<String> supportedLocales, boolean assumeEnglishIsSupported)
private Locale computeFirstMatch(Collection<String> supportedLocales, boolean assumeEnglishIsSupported)
public Locale getFirstMatch(String[] supportedLocales)
methods.comment:
* Returns the first match in the locale list given an unordered array of supported locales
     * in BCP 47 format.
     *
     * @return The first {@link Locale} from this list that appears in the given array, or
     *     {@code null} if the {@link LocaleList} is empty.

methods.name: public Locale getFirstMatchWithEnglishSupported(String[] supportedLocales)
methods.comment:
* Same as getFirstMatch(), but with English assumed to be supported, even if it's not.
     * {@hide}

methods.name: public static boolean isPseudoLocalesOnly(@Nullable String[] supportedLocales)
public static LocaleList getDefault()
methods.comment:
* The result is guaranteed to include the default Locale returned by Locale.getDefault(), but * not necessarily at the top of the list. The default locale not being at the top of the list * is an indication that the system has set the default locale to one of the user's other * preferred locales, having concluded that the primary preference is not supported but a * secondary preference is. * *

Note that the default LocaleList would change if Locale.setDefault() is called. This * method takes that into account by always checking the output of Locale.getDefault() and * recalculating the default LocaleList if needed.

methods.name: public static LocaleList getAdjustedDefault()
methods.comment:
* Returns the default locale list, adjusted by moving the default locale to its first
     * position.

methods.name: public static void setDefault(@NonNull @Size(min = 1) LocaleList locales)
methods.comment: * Also sets the default locale by calling Locale.setDefault() with the first locale in the * list. * * @throws NullPointerException if the input is null. * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input is empty.

methods.name: public static void setDefault(@NonNull @Size(min = 1) LocaleList locales, int localeIndex)
methods.comment:
* This may be used directly by system processes to set the default locale list for apps. For
     * such uses, the default locale list would always come from the user preferences, but the
     * default locale may have been chosen to be a locale other than the first locale in the locale
     * list (based on the locales the app supports).
     *
     * {@hide}

public static void setDefault(@NonNull @Size(min = 1) LocaleList locales)
public static void setDefault(@NonNull @Size(min = 1) LocaleList locales, int localeIndex)
